name: Obskewer
tagline: A light-weight Java application for coded messages
body:
What is Obskewer?

Obskewer is a light-weight Java application for encoding and decoding text using common ciphers. Supported Ciphers:
  • ClassicShift (the form of the Caesar Cipher used with the initial release of this software)
  • The Caesar Cipher
  • Morse code
  • Letter-Numbers (swapping alphabet letters with their position in the alphabet)
  • "Skip" (or a form of Scytale) (better described here)(coming soon)
To use, obtain the JAR file on the Releases tab and run it like any program (typically, you double-click on it). To quit the program, type "quit" when prompted. This program works better with UTF-8, obviously. Logo font is Paper Cuts 2. Used properly.

Credits

  • http://rumkin.com/tools/cipher/
  • http://rosettacode.org/wiki/Caesar_cipher#Java
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
